summary: study aimed to evaluate the anti-influenza viral activity and possible mechanisms of 12 phenanthrenes from the medicinal plant Bletilla striata. phenanthrenes 1, 2, 3, 4, 6, 9, 10, 11, and 12 significantly inhibited the viruses in vivo. phenanthrenes 2, 3, 4, 6, 7 10, and 11 exhibited inhibitory activities. the IC50 ranged from 18.4 3.1 to 42.3 3.9 M in the post-treatment assays. no compound could inhibit hemagglutination by the influenza virus.
